text: I think entrepreneurship is what drives --
it's that human spirit and human need
to break boundaries, you know,
to try new things, to be innovative.
That belief in self that --

I see this and so I have a
conviction that I can do this
and I find a way
to make it happen and to get it done.
So I think the tech entrepreneurs seem

to make it look like it's such an
easy thing to be an entrepreneur.
You know, and they're so psychedelic
and so suave with their language.
But entrepreneurship is tough
and you make decisions

that affect people's lives,
affect their livelihoods.
I think it's a bigger responsibility than

sometimes it is perceived
because it always has impact.

That impact can be positive
and the impact can be negative.
So you want to be very careful

if you're going to go
into entrepreneurship to be sure

that your values, your principles
and your reason --

my reason initially was that
I wanted to be financially independent,

and I wanted to prove that good
things could happen in Nigeria.
But as I matured and as I evolved,

I realized that I was actually
impacting a lot more lives

and so the need to pay attention
to my own personal brand

was very important.
To live by example,
to lead by example was very important.
